resources.string: We got something to ask you…
Flyer uses notifications to update you on your file transfer progress. If you choose to not receive notifications, you can still enable them later in your device\'s settings.
This device is now visible to all devices connected to the same WiFi network as you.
Received files will be stored in the Downloads folder.
Make sure the receiving device is connected to the same WiFi network as you.
You are connected to a WiFi network and have your hotspot enabled at the same time. Flyer will search for devices in the external WiFi network.
The device can\'t receive any file at the moment.
We need permission from you to save received files in your download folder (plis don\'t click don\'t ask again).
Allow Flyer to work when screen is turned off

The Android OS automatically hibernates apps when the screen is turned off in order to save battery.
However, this optimizations will stop any operation in progress.

You can override this behaviour by going into Settings, switching from "Apps not optimized" to "All" and deselecting Flyer in the list of apps.

The Android OS automatically hibernates apps when the screen is turned off in order to save battery. However, this optimisations will stop any operation in progress. You can override this behaviour by going into Settings, tapping on Battery, and disabling optimisations.
You\'re not connected to any network
Flyer can send files to any device connected to your local network. Connect to a WiFi or enable the hotspot to continue.
